main event: A civilian in Morrisville, Pennsylvania reported seeing an unidentified flying object in September 1966.
interesting points: The sighting was reported to the U.S. Air Force's Project Blue Book, which investigated UFO reports.
The observer was a Technical Controller at Johnsville Naval Air Station and his wife.
The object was described as a bright white, round light, about the size of a basketball, that moved extremely rapidly and disappeared suddenly.
The object was observed at an elevation of 25-30 degrees and the sighting occurred under overcast sky conditions.

The Air Force requested the observer to fill out a more detailed report form (PFD Form 164) for further evaluation, but the original report did not contain sufficient information for a conclusive evaluation.
witnesses: a civilian, a Technical Controller at Johnsville Naval Air Station, and his wife
